detaileddescription.para: File open modes
File access permission modes (not all enums apply in Windows)

briefdescription.para: Offset is set to the given offset bytes.
Offset is set to its current location plus offset bytes.
Offset is set to the size of the file plus offset bytes.

detaileddescription.para: File seek modes
File permission modes
Pipes creation flags
Bit-mask of OS_FILE_PERMISSION's
Machine unique ID for file
File status info
Opaque object that represents a process that we can wait for its termination

memberdef.argsstring: (const CHAR *path, INT flags, OS_FILE_PERMISSION_TYPE mode, NATIVE_FD *fd)
memberdef.name: OS_OpenFD

detaileddescription.para: The file name specified by path is opened for reading and/or writing, as specified by the argument flags.

parameterdescription.para: or'ed OS_FILE_OPEN_TYPE. If mode OS_FILE_OPEN_TYPE_CREATE was given, the file is created with mode.
If a new file will be created as a result of this operation, this is the mode of this newly created file. This argument contains values from OS_FILE_PERMISSION_TYPE combined with bitwise OR.

simplesect.para: fd - Assigned with the file descriptor

simplesect.title: Availability:
simplesect.para: O/S: Windows, Linux & macOS* CPU: All

detaileddescription.para: Attempts to write count bytes of data to the object referenced by the descriptor fd from the buffer pointed to by buffer.

simplesect.para: size Assigned with the number of bytes successfully written

simplesect.title: Availability:
simplesect.para: O/S: Windows, Linux & macOS* CPU: All

detaileddescription.para: Attempts to read count bytes of data from the object referenced by the descriptor fd to the buffer pointed to by buffer.

simplesect.para: size Assigned with the number of bytes successfully read buffer Contains count bytes that were read from fd

detaileddescription.para: Reposition the offset of the file descriptor fd to the an offset in, the file denoted by offset. The offset is measured with relation to a starting point determined by the directive whence.

simplesect.para: offset - Assigned with the number of bytes successfully read

simplesect.title: Availability:
simplesect.para: O/S: Windows, Linux & macOS* CPU: All

detaileddescription.para:
Check whether a file descriptor is the application's console. A file descriptor is the application's console if:
The file of the underlying descriptor is a terminal device.
The terminal device is the tty master (or console) of the current application.
The practical implication of a console file descriptor is that every write operation to it needs to be flushed right away because the user on the other side expects to see output immediately.

parameterdescription.para: non-zero if 'fd' is the application's console. Zero otherwise.

simplesect.title: Availability:
simplesect.para: O/S: Windows, Linux & macOS* CPU: All

detaileddescription.para: Attempts to read count bytes of data from the directory referenced by the descriptor fd to the buffer pointed to by buffer. A console file descriptor usually needs to be flushed after every read/write operation.

simplesect.para: count - Assigned with the number of bytes successfully read buffer - Contains count bytes that were read from fd

simplesect.title: Availability:
simplesect.para: O/S: Windows, Linux & macOS* CPU: All

detaileddescription.para: Get the permissions type requested when fd was opened. This is useful to check whether we can read or write fd.

parameterdescription.para: The permissions of the file descriptor.

simplesect.title: Availability:
simplesect.para: O/S: Windows, Linux & macOS* CPU: All

detaileddescription.para: Reads the symbolic link pointed by path. Returns the path that the symlink points to.

parameterdescription.para: Path to the symbolic link to read.
The path where the symlink points to.
The number of bytes in buf, returns the number of bytes filled inside buf.

detaileddescription.para: Get unique ID for an opened file, identified by a file descriptor. Two opened file descriptors for the same physical file are guaranteed to have the same unique ID.

parameterdescription.para: File descriptor to calculate an ID.
The calculate unique ID (opaque binary data)

simplesect.title: Availability:
simplesect.para: O/S: Linux CPU: All

detaileddescription.para: Creates a copy of a file descriptor using the lowest available free file descriptor. This function considers the value returned from OS_GetLowestFileDescriptorToUse() when duplicating the descriptor.

parameterdescription.para: File descriptor to duplicate an ID.
TRUE to duplicate the close-on-exec property of the descriptor, FALSE otherwise.

simplesect.title: Availability:
simplesect.para: O/S: Linux & macOS* CPU: All

detaileddescription.para: Truncates a file referenced by fd to a size of length bytes. If the original file size is bigger than length, the extra data is lost. If the original file size is smaller than length,the file extended.

parameterdescription.para: File descriptor to change his size.

simplesect.title: Availability:
simplesect.para: O/S: Windows & Linux & macOS* CPU: All

detaileddescription.para: Expands all symbolic links or junction points and resolves references to '.', '..' and extra '/' characters in the null-terminated string named by 'path' to produce a canonicalized absolute pathname.

parameterdescription.para: path name. can be full or relative
if TRUE - function checks if the canonical path exists and returns NULL in case it does not. if FALSE - function returns the canonical path (regardless of it's existence)

simplesect.title: Availability:
simplesect.para: O/S: Windows & Linux & macOS* CPU: All

detaileddescription.para: Record a file descriptor as opened by OS-APIs. Later, we allow to query whether a certain file descriptor was opened by OS-APIs or not.

simplesect.title: Availability:
simplesect.para: O/S: Linux & macOS* CPU: All

detaileddescription.para: Record that a file descriptor opened by OS-APIs is not longer valid, and it is closed. Later, we allow to query whether a certain file descriptor was opened by OS-APIs or not.

simplesect.title: Availability:
simplesect.para: O/S: Linux & macOS* CPU: All

detaileddescription.para: Getter function to retrieve the lowest value of file descriptor that OS-APIs should use. OS-APIs will attempt to only use file descriptors which are larger or equal to the value that this function returns.
This function is implemented as a weak reference symbol so libraries linked with OS-APIs may provide their own implementation of this function and return a different value.

simplesect.title: Availability:
simplesect.para: O/S: Linux & macOS* CPU: All

detaileddescription.para: Relocate the file descriptor to the range permitted according to OS_GetLowestFileDescriptorToUse(), then record a file descriptor as opened by OS-APIs. Later, we allow to query whether a certain file descriptor was opened by OS-APIs or not.

parameterdescription.para: File descriptor to relocate and record.

simplesect.title: Availability:
simplesect.para: O/S: Linux & macOS* CPU: All

detaileddescription.para: Queries whether a certain file descriptor was opened by OS-APIs or not.

simplesect.title: Availability:
simplesect.para: O/S: Linux & macOS* CPU: All
